Stall.description:
Chansey is one of the bulkier walls by virtue of high HP and Eviolite, walling many prominent special attackers such as Primarina, Magnezone, and Volcanion. Toxic helps dispatch threats that can heal up on Chansey such as defensive Arcanine, Roost Kyurem, and non-Rest Togekiss. Soft-Boiled helps to keep Chansey at high HP while slowly whittling down the foe with the combination of Seismic Toss and Toxic. While Chansey's physical bulk is not nearly as good as its special bulk, the given EV investment allows for its to be as physically bulky as possible, giving it the best chance to survive a hit from Choice item Haxorus, Choice Scarf Galarian Darmanitan, and non-Swords Dance Landorus-Therian, to OHKO them with Counter. Charm is an option over Counter to handle physical attackers that would like to set up on Chansey such as Shell Smash Crustle, Swords Dance Landorus-Therian, and non-Taunt Bulk Up Zeraora. Charm should be used to PP stall and negate boosts from the foe's setup moves to a point where any combination of Chansey's moves will win. Do note that replacing Counter with Charm usually results in losing matchups against Choice Band users such as Landorus-Therian and Choice Band Zeraora, which can 2HKO Chansey through Charm.

Chansey is taken advantage of by Choice item attackers with Trick such as Cresselia, Porygon-Z, and Tapu Fini. Toxic can assist in dealing certain anti-stall measures such as Encore and Trick Togekiss and some Fake Tears Sylveon. Versus Sylveon it is optimal to use Toxic on the first turn, then Seismic Toss, then Soft-Boiled, and finally Seismic Toss to avoid being KOed by Hyper Beam at -6. Good teammates for Chansey are attackers that don't care about Trick and are able to retaliate, such as Assault Vest or Choice item Metagross and Aromatisse. Chansey also doesn't appreciate faster Taunt users such as Spectrier and Corviknight, as they PP stall Chansey and slowly chip it down. Good partners that alleviate this weakness include Choice Scarf Galarian Darminatan and Zeraora.

Maranga Berry + Eerie Impulse.description:
Set Description

The combination of Substitute and Roost allows Zapdos to stall out foes by decreasing their PP. Thunderbolt helps versus Trick + Choice Scarf and Encore users like Togekiss and Primarina, respectively. However, this set uniquely beats Pokemon like Choice Specs Porygon-Z and Volcanion as well, using Eerie Impulse to survive their strong hits.

EVs

76 Speed EVs with a Timid nature get the jump on Modest Porygon-Z, and the special bulk allows Zapdos to survive Draco Meteor from Modest Choice Specs Naganadel. The remaining EVs are put in Defense to help versus Pokemon like Choice Band Kartana and Assault Vest Arcanine.

Usage Tips

Against SubSeed Rillaboom, use Substitute turn 1 to block Leech Seed, but use Roost against faster special attackers like Naganadel to capitalize on the Maranga Berry boost. Eerie Impulse helps Zapdos survive hits from slower special attackers such as Choice Specs Porygon-Z. Instead of a status move, Zapdos should use Thunderbolt versus Encore users like Primarina, as well as faster Taunt or Trick users such as Tapu Fini and Togekiss.

Offensive Life Orb.description:
Set Description

Life Orb Zapdos OHKOes prominent threats with its STAB Hurricane, like both Urshifu formes and Volcarona. Heat Wave provides a super effective move against Steel-types like Magnezone and Ferrothorn. Thunderbolt allows Zapdos to beat Pokemon like Togekiss, Volcanion, and Primarina, but Thunder may be used instead to OHKO bulky Primarina. Protect provides insurance against Custap Berry users like Galarian Moltres and Primarina, while Laser Focus + Heat Wave beats Registeel. Metal Sound helps versus Calm Mind stall Pokemon like Cresselia.

EVs

Maximum Speed EVs let Zapdos outspeed both Urshifu formes and Speed tie with other base 100 Speed Pokemon like opposing Zapdos, Volcarona, and Entei. The HP and Special Defense investment is used to tank Overheat from Volcanion after Life Orb recoil.

Usage Tips

Usually use Hurricane on neutral targets, as it will do the most damage, and use super effective moves when applicable. If running Thunderbolt, use it versus Primarina, and use Protect if it doesn't OHKO to safeguard against Custap Berry sets. Laser Focus should be used turn 1 versus stall Pokemon like Registeel.

Eerie Impulse + Life Orb.description:
Set Description

Zapdos combines its defensive and offensive utility in this set. Eerie Impulse and Roost allow it to survive hits from slower special attackers like Choice Specs Porygon-Z, Volcanion, and Primarina. Charge Beam improves the Cresselia matchup, as it can boost Zapdos's Special Attack and has a lot of PP. Hurricane hits both Urshifu formes for super effective damage while providing a high damage output overall.

EVs

232 Speed EVs with the Timid nature get the jump on both Urshifu formes, and the 96 Special Defense EVs allow Zapdos to survive a Hyper Beam from Choice Specs Porygon-Z after an Eerie Impulse.

Usage Tips

Use Eerie Impulse against threatening special attackers such as Porygon-Z. When attacking, use the strongest move, except against Cresselia. There, use Charge Beam in tandem with Eerie Impulse and Roost until Zapdos can do considerable damage with Hurricane.

PP Stall.description:
Set Description

Zapdos can effectively stall out foes' PP with its ability Pressure and Substitute + Protect. Substitute can block status moves from Pokemon like SubSeed Celesteela and Rillaboom. Protect lets Zapdos scout the foe's move. Toxic is extremely useful to KO foes more quickly and cripple other stall Pokemon lacking Rest, like stall Cresselia or Gastrodon. Thunderbolt prevents Zapdos from being a fully passive option. It can deal super effective damage to Trick + Choice Scarf and Taunt users such as Togekiss and Tapu Fini.

EVs

Maximum Speed investment allows Zapdos to Speed tie other base 100 Speed Pokemon like Entei, Volcarona, and opposing Zapdos and Galarian Zapdos. The 200 HP EVs allow Substitute to be used five times, and the remaining EVs are put in Defense to reduce damage from opposing Struggle.

Usage Tips

Use Protect first to quickly start stalling and block status moves, then use Substitute to block the foe's next move. Zapdos can continue this cycle until their PP is depleted. Toxic can be used when behind a Substitute, putting foes on a timer. Thunderbolt should be used against Trick + Choice Scarf or Taunt users like Togekiss and Tapu Fini, as well as Primarina due to Encore.

Choice Specs.description:
Set Description

Thunderbolt and Hurricane are strong STAB moves that KO top-tier Pokemon like Togekiss, Tapu Fini, and both Urshifu formes. Heat Wave hits Steel-types like Ferrothorn, Magnezone, and certain Metagross sets hard, while Charge Beam improves the Cresselia matchup. Static can potentially cripple physical attackers such as Arcanine and Urshifu-R. Pressure can be used to potentially bluff a stall set.

EVs

This set runs maximum Speed EVs to Speed tie other base 100 Speed Pokemon like Entei, Volcarona, and opposing Zapdos and Galarian Zapdos.

Usage Tips

Usually, use the strongest move for the target, but against Cresselia, use Charge Beam so Zapdos can keep up with Cresselia's Calm Mind boosts.

Moltres-Galar.comments:
Other Options

Galarian Moltres may also use Sitrus Berry to beat Assault Vest Entei or Wacan Berry to beat Regieleki.

Custap Berry.description:
Set Description

Galarian Moltres is a bulky special attacker that uses Special Attack boosts from Berserk and Nasty Plot to overwhelm its opponents. Its typing allows it to beat Dragapult, Cresselia, Spectrier, and both Urshifu formes with STAB Fiery Wrath and Hurricane. Endure + Custap Berry provides a free turn versus most Pokemon to attack, setup Nasty Plot, or use Endure on frail offensive Pokemon like Choice item Galarian Darmanitan. Galarian Moltres has good matchups against Pokemon like stall Azumarill, some Ferrothorn, and most Celesteela thanks to Nasty Plot.

EVs

140 HP and 248 Defense EVs allow Galarian Moltres to survive Outrage from Adamant Choice Band Haxorus and Fishious Rend from Adamant Choice Scarf Dracovish. The remaining EVs are put into Special Attack for maximum damage output.

An alternate EV spread of 80 HP / 192 Def / 124 SpA / 112 Spe with a Modest nature has a better SubSeed Celesteela and Taunt Corviknight matchup, but has worse matchups versus Haxorus and Dracovish. The Defense EVs survive Close Combat from Choice Band Urshifu, while the HP EVs allow Galarian Moltres to live Choice Specs Volcanion's Overheat. The Speed investment is for Celesteela while the remaining EVs are put in Special Attack.

Usage Tips

Against Pokemon that cannot threaten to OHKO Galarian Moltres, such as Haxorus, Urshifu, and Naganadel, it should attack on turn 1. An exception to this is Celesteela, where Galarian Moltres should use Nasty Plot once and 2HKO with Fiery Wrath afterward. Against foes that threaten to OHKO Galarian Moltres, such as Galarian Darmanitan, Endure allows it to survive the hit and OHKO back.

When facing foes that both have the option of OHKOing Galarian Moltres or not, such as Porygon-Z and Life Orb Dracovish, Galarian Moltres can either use Endure against a move that would otherwise OHKO, or predict that the foe will play around it and use an attacking move or Nasty Plot to save Endure for the next turn. Some prediction is also required versus Metagross, since Nasty Plot should be used on Weakness Policy variants, while Fiery Wrath is used on other variants.

Assault Vest.description:
Set Description

Assault Vest Galarian is strong against special attackers, such as Magnezone, Volcanion, and non-Life Orb Porygon-Z. It is also strong against common Custap Berry users, such as Magnezone and Sawk. Snarl has reliable matchups against Porygon-Z, Magnezone, Volcanion, and Heatran.

EVs

The HP and Defense investment enables Galarian Moltres to survive a Meteor Mash from +2 Adamant Metagross.

The Special Defense allows it to beat Choice Specs Magnezone. The Speed investment is for Modest Magnezone, and the remaining EVs are put into Special Attack.

Usage Tips

Against an opposing Porygon-Z, Galarian Moltres should use Snarl on turn 1, Fiery Wrath on turn 2, and Sucker Punch on turn 3. Against an opposing Metagross, Galarian Moltres should use Fiery Wrath turn 1. If the damage reveals Assault Vest Metagross, then it should use another Fiery Wrath and then use Sucker Punch on turn 3. If the opposing Metagross either is a Weakness Policy or Choice Band set, Galarian Moltres should use Sucker Punch immediately afterward. Against an opposing Magnezone, Galarian Moltres should use Snarl on the first two turns, Fiery Wrath on turn 3, and Sucker Punch on turn 4.

Rocky Helmet.description:
Set Description

Rocky Helmet Galarian Moltres uses Nasty Plot and Taunt to have better matchups versus stall Pokemon, such as Ferrothorn and Chansey, and physical attackers, such as Assault Vest Metagross and specially defensive Haxorus, while still hitting Dark-, Ghost-, Fighting-, and Grass-types with its STAB moves.

EVs

The HP and Defense EVs allow Galarian Moltres to not be 2HKOed by Gyro Ball from non-Adamant Ferrothorn while maximizing odds against Choice Scarf Volcanion. The Special Attack allows Galarian Moltres to OHKO most Ferrothorn sets after a Nasty Plot, a boost from Berserk, and a turn of Rocky Helmet damage. The remaining EVs are put in Speed.

Usage Tips

Against an opposing Ferrothorn, Galarian Moltres should use Nasty Plot on turn 1, Taunt on turn 2, and Hurricane on turn 3. Against an opposing Chansey, Galarian Moltres should always use Taunt on turn 1, Nasty Plot on turn 2, and Fiery Wrath on turn 3. If Chansey uses Seismic Toss once during the first three turns, Galarian Moltres can use Taunt again and use Fiery Wrath twice to secure the win. If Chansey uses Seismic Toss twice during the first three turns, Galarian Moltres should use Taunt on turn 4 and Hurricane on turn 5 to secure the win. If Chansey uses Seismic Toss on all three of the first three turns, Galarian Moltres should use Fiery Wrath on turn 4 to secure the win. However, against specially defensive Chansey sets, some prediction is required with when to use Taunt.

Some prediction is also required against Metagross, as Galarian Moltres should use Nasty Plot against Weakness Policy variants and Fiery Wrath against all other sets.

Azumarill.comments:
Other Options

Azumarill can use Belly Drum to destroy stall Pokemon like Registeel and Galarian Corsola, but it loses longevity and is inconsistent. With either alternate EV spread of the Assault Vest set, Azumarill can use Iron Tail on the Assault Vest set to have a more reliable matchup versus Sylveon. Scald is also an option on stall Azumarill for a better matchup against foes that can boost past Azumarill's Charm, like Swords Dance Garchomp and Iron Defense + Body Press Ferrothorn, although this can be inconsistent due to it relying on burns.

Choice Band.description:
Set Description

Huge Power and Choice Band boost Azumarill's Attack to demolish foes. Liquidation and Play Rough hit type-weak and neutral targets like Arcanine, Garchomp, Tapu Lele, and Metagross hard. Aqua Jet is used for Pressure Entei and Nihilego, while Iron Tail is used for Fairy-types like Aromatisse and Sylveon. Knock Off is for better odds against Spectrier and Aegislash. Azumarill is very good for dealing with soft checks to Fairy-types such as Goodra and Tyranitar due to it hitting physically, unlike most viable Fairy-types. Choice Band guarantees it KOes most of its targets.

EVs

The bulk EVs allow Azumarill to survive Choice Band Urshifu's Poison Jab and non-Choice Specs Sylveon's Hyper Beam. The 6 Speed IVs let it underspeed Aegislash, hitting its Blade forme after it attacks.

Usage Tips

Against Entei, you want to use Aqua Jet, since using Liquidation can make Azumarill run out of PP against Protect + Substitute variants.

Assault Vest.description:
Set Description

Assault Vest allows Azumarill to survive strong and super effective special attackers that it previously could not handle, such as Magnezone and Primarina. Superpower beats Magnezone and non-Reflect and non-Choice Specs Porygon-Z. Dig can be used to greatly improve the odds to beat Naganadel while still beating Magnezone. Aqua Jet picks off weakened foes, Custap Berry users, and Sturdy users like Magnezone, Garchomp, Primarina, and Porygon-Z.

EVs

The bulk investment and Assault Vest allow Azumarill to survive Choice Specs Magnezone's Thunderbolt and Choice Band Urshifu's Poison Jab. The rest is dumped into Attack, notably improving your odds against Togekiss, Primarina, Magnezone, and Garchomp.

An alternate spread of 88 HP / 168 Atk / 252 SpD with a Careful nature lets Azumarill tank Choice Specs Porygon-Z's Hyper Beam while maximizing Attack.

Usage Tips

Using the highest damaging move will most likely give you the win. Against low health foes, especially Custap Berry + Sturdy users like Sawk and Magnezone, you should always use Aqua Jet to KO them. Against opponents like Aromatisse, Gardevoir, or Ninetales-Alola which may be using Encore and Disable together, you should alternate between Play Rough and Liquidation to secure the matchup. Specifically against Gardevoir, if put in a situation where Azumarill has a move disabled and Gardevoir can click Encore the next turn without the move failing, Azumarill should click Aqua Jet so that it cannot be forced to Struggle. However, against Salazzle, Azumarill should instead switch between Liquidation and Aqua Jet to avoid being forced to struggle. Against Sawk and non-Choice Band Crustle, prediction is required with using Aqua Jet and either Liquidation or Play Rough to avoid the foe's Counter OHKOing Azumarill.

Stall.description:
Set Description

This set stalls out would-be checks such as Celesteela and Grass types such as Rillaboom, Zarude, and some Tapu Bulu sets. Amnesia and Charm both weaken incoming attacks, eventually letting Azumarill chip foes down with Seismic Toss. Icy Wind can be used over Seismic Toss to beat Aggron and secure the matchup against all Tapu Bulu sets, and Rest provides recovery and removes status conditions, such as Entei's Toxic. Additionally, Sap Sipper gives Azumarill an immunity to incoming Grass-type attacks from foes like Rillaboom, Tapu Bulu, and Zarude, and it prevents Leech Seed users like Whimsicott from taking advantage of Azumarill's passivity.

EVs

The Defense investment allows Azumarill to survive a Poison Jab followed by a Charm-weakened Poison Jab from Choice Band Urshifu, as well as the best odds of defeating Galarian Darmanitan, since having maximum Defense EVs does not change the roll. The rest of the EVs are dumped into Special Defense for improved odds to beat Timid Porygon-Z and Choice Specs Spectrier. Minimizing Azumarill's Attack helps to lower confusion self-damage, which slightly improves the matchup against foes like Galarian Moltres.

Usage Tips

Against Tapu Fini, Azumarill should use Amnesia once and then repeatedly use Seismic Toss. This takes advantage of Tapu Fini's tendency to Iron Defense immediately against Azumarill. By boosting its Special Defense, Azumarill lowers the healing Tapu Fini gets from Draining Kiss, so it cannot outheal Azumarill's Seismic Toss. When facing Entei, you should continuously use Seismic Toss to beat it reliably. When using Icy Wind against Aggron, Azumarill should use Icy Wind turn 1. If Aggron uses Head Smash, Rest should be used until the foe faints from recoil damage. If Aggron uses any other move, Azumarill should use a combination of Charm and Rest to stall out Aggron's pp instead.

Entei.comments:
Other Options

Assault Vest Entei can use Pressure over Inner Focus to bluff stall, but generally Inner Focus is better to maintain consistency versus Togekiss, Arcanine, and random moves with flinch chances like Galarian Moltres's Fiery Wrath.

Entei can run a Life Orb set with Inner Focus, EVs of 184 HP / 92 Atk / 16 Def / 216 Spe, and an Adamant nature for a more reliable matchup against Togekiss, Avalugg, Steelix, and Zapdos, using a moveset of Sacred Fire / Extreme Speed / Will-O-Wisp / Eruption; Bulldoze can be slotted in over Will-O-Wisp to beat Heatran. Life Orb Entei sees far less usage due to its few upsides and lower consistency in practice than Assault Vest.

Pressure Stall.description:
Set Description

Pressure stall Entei can easily beat many slower attackers, such as Choice Specs Volcanion, Venusaur, Dracozolt, and Assault Vest Goodra, while also dealing with some faster attackers like Zarude, Pheromosa, and Kartana well. Leftovers is mandatory to create more Substitutes. Protect and Substitute stall out opposing attacks easily, such as Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow and Volcanion's Steam Eruption, and Protect adds Leftovers healing to make more Substitutes. Sacred Fire can turn tough matchups versus Pokemon like Zeraora into winning ones with a single burn; on the other hand, Flare Blitz can be used for a more reliable Galarian Darmanitan matchup and more PP, which can help versus some opposing stall Pokemon like Galarian Corsola. Toxic is standard on Pressure stall Pokemon like Entei to take advantage of foes that require setup to OHKO them, such as Volcarona and opposing stall Pokemon like Chansey. Laser Focus is a potential option to defeat Registeel, since critical hits ignore Registeel's Defense boosts through Iron Defense.

EVs

252 Defense EVs give the best possible odds to beat Adamant Choice Scarf Galarian Darmanitan. 252 Speed EVs with a Jolly nature Speed tie Zapdos, Galarian Zapdos, and opposing Entei, and they outspeed all base 95s, most notably Galarian Darmanitan and Tapu Lele.

Usage Tips

Against a vast majority of Pokemon, the win path is usually stalling out their super effective moves via Pressure's doubled PP consumption, Substitute, and Protect. Toxic assists in this task versus Pokemon that don't rely on direct attacks to win, such as Chansey and stall Cresselia, or Pokemon that are too weak to OHKO Entei, like Zapdos. Versus Registeel, if you run Laser Focus, use Laser Focus turn 1 and then alternate between your Fire-type attack and it, or use Substitute turn 2 instead if Counter is revealed.

Assault Vest.description:
Set Description

Assault Vest Entei chooses to tank hits and outdamage its targets. Inner Focus is used to defeat Choice Scarf Togekiss and non-Choice Band Arcanine. Sacred Fire can be used for the 50% burn chance, but Flare Blitz is generally better for its higher damage and PP, defeating Venusaur and Aromatisse far more reliably. Bulldoze is mandatory to deal with Pokemon such as Heatran, Assault Vest Arcanine, and Spectrier. Eruption deals incredible damage to Pokemon with low Special Defense, such as Steelix, Registeel, and Avalugg, while making the Aromatisse matchup more consistent. Stone Edge, however, can be used instead to deal with Kee Berry Volcarona and Rotom-H. Extreme Speed is an excellent, high-damage move that deals with Custap Berry users and Air Balloon Heatran.

EVs

The Special Defense and HP investment lets Entei tank two Earth Powers from Modest Heatran. With a Jolly nature, 216 Speed EVs outspeed Adamant Choice Band Galarian Darmanitan, and Entei still defeats Venusaur if using Flare Blitz. An Adamant nature can be used instead to make the Aromatisse matchup more consistent, but this loses out on the Galarian Darmanitan matchup.

An alternative EV spread of 8 HP / 76 Atk / 208 Def / 216 Spe with a Jolly nature gives a more reliable Galarian Darmanitan matchup, tanking Jolly Choice Scarf Darmanitan's Earthquake.

Usage Tips

Use Extreme Speed on Air Balloon Pokemon like Heatran. Sacred Fire is used on targets that instantaneously lose when burned, such as Zeraora. Use Eruption versus Aromatisse if you think it is physically defensive, and Flare Blitz or Sacred Fire otherwise. Eruption is also used for Steelix and Avalugg. Entei is fairly straightforward outside of these scenarios; the most effective move usually wins.

Metagross.comments:
Other Options

Metagross can run an Occa Berry set using Meteor Mash, Bullet Punch, Rock Tomb, and Earthquake with an EV spread of 184 HP / 252 Atk / 40 Def / 32 Spe, which lets it survive Adamant Dracozolt's Bolt Beak. This set hopes to lure in Heatran, which it beats by landing Rock Tomb into Earthquake. However, this set is a very situational lure, so it isn't recommended.

Assault Vest.description:
Set Description

Meteor Mash, besides nailing Steel-weak targets like Sylveon and Tapu Lele, is Metagross's best neutral STAB move for targets like Azumarill and Porygon-Z. Bullet Punch finishes off weakened foes and is extremely useful for KOing Sturdy or Custap Berry users like Sawk, Magnezone, and Primarina. Earthquake hits Steel- and Electric-types like Tapu Koko, most Zeraora, and Magnezone. Ice Punch hits non-Choice Band Landorus-T and Landorus, Zapdos, Dragapult, and some Garchomp. Power-Up Punch is a useful alternative for better matchups against Iron Defense Tapu Koko and Iron Defense Tapu Fini. Assault Vest offers reliability versus the aforementioned Primarina and Landorus, and it lets Metagross survive super effective hits from Pokemon like Hydreigon.

EVs

Assault Vest with 204 HP and 144 Special Defense EVs allows Metagross to survive Sparking Aria twice from Choice Specs Primarina. The HP EVs also allow Metagross to survive Life Orb Zeraora's Knock Off after Bulk Up. The remaining EVs are dumped into Attack for better KO odds versus Dragapult.

Usage Tips

There are some matchups that are a bit different than using the highest damaging move. For example, against Crustle you use Bullet Punch turn 1 because it can use Counter, and then KO it with Meteor Mash the next turn. Versus Tapu Fini, use Meteor Mash instead of Power-Up Punch turn 1 to avoid getting locked into Power-Up Punch by Trick. Against Tapu Koko, use Earthquake turn 1, and if it uses Iron Defense, start using Power-Up Punch until Earthquake can 2HKO it. Against Encore + Disable users like Gardevoir, Alolan Ninetales, and Aromatisse, always use Meteor Mash turn 1, and use Bullet Punch turn 2 to avoid being forced to use Struggle. Against Togekiss, you should use Bullet Punch turn 1 to scout its set. If it's Kee Berry or Babiri Berry, you should use Power-Up Punch turn 2 and then use Meteor Mash turn 3. Even if it uses Encore turn 2, you can still finish it off by using Bullet Punch when Metagross's Encore ends. If it's another Togekiss set, you can use Meteor Mash turn 2 to finish it off.

Weakness Policy.description:
Set Description

Weakness Policy is beneficial for Kartana, opposing Metagross, and Zeraora. Meteor Mash hits neutral targets like Haxorus and Regidrago hard. Bullet Punch finishes off weakened foes and Custap Berry users such as Sylveon and Magnezone. Earthquake hits Steel- and Electric-types like Regieleki and Carracosta. Psychic may seem like an odd choice, but it helps versus a few foes that Zen Headbutt wouldn't beat, such as Counter Sawk, Iron Defense Urshifu-R, Kartana, and Avalugg. Endure helps against Galarian Darmanitan and Choice Band Dragapult. Weakness Policy surprises many Pokemon that Metagross can tank supereffective hits from and KO back, such as Assault Vest Entei and Choice Band Steelix.

EVs

248 HP EVs and 28 Defense EVs ensure that Metagross beats Haxorus. The remaining EVs are dumped into Attack to reliably beat all Regidrago sets. Metagross can run 8 Speed IVs to still outspeed Azumarill and have a better chance at activating Weakness Policy against Incineroar or some variants of Tyranitar, and it can even run 0 Speed IVs for a better opposing Metagross matchup. However, Metagross will lose reliably versus Primarina with less Speed investment.

Usage Tips

Against Crustle you should use Bullet Punch turn 1 because it can use Counter, and then KO it with Meteor Mash the next turn. Against Encore + Disable users like Gardevoir, Alolan Ninetales, and Aromatisse, always use Meteor Mash turn 1, and use Bullet Punch turn 2 to avoid being forced to use Struggle. Against Galarian Darmanitan, you should use Endure to survive Flare Blitz and KO back with +2 Bullet Punch. Against Dragapult, you should use Endure on turn 2 if Phantom Force is used, and use Bullet Punch on turns where Phantom Force will not hit. However, other Dragapult sets like Choice Specs will beat you, so be wary of that.

Choice Band.description:
Set Description

Equipped with a Choice Band, Metagross can demolish Pokemon that check other sets like Regidrago and Zeraora. Meteor Mash hits neutral targets like Porygon-Z hard while also hitting targets like Aromatisse super effectively. Bullet Punch beats Galarian Darmanitan and Earthquake beats Zeraora, Magnezone, and some Arcanine and Incineroar sets. Trick beats various stall Pokemon like Cresselia, Galarian Corsola, and Ferrothorn. Ice Punch allows it to KO Garchomp and bulky Regidrago sets, while Zen Headbutt hits offensive Urshifu-R and Galarian Zapdos.

EVs

The HP EVs ensure Metagross survives Custap Berry Dracozolt's Bolt Beak, and the Special Defense EVs allow it to survive Dragon Energy into Draco Meteor from Custap Berry Regidrago. The remaining EVs are dumped into Attack for better damage versus Togekiss and Regidrago. However, an alternative spread of 252 Atk / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with a Jolly nature allows it to outspeed neutral-nature base 80 Speed Pokemon, like Regidrago. Here, maximum Attack gives it the best KO odds versus Tyranitar. If you are running these EVs, you should run Thunder Punch as the fourth move for a better Celesteela matchup.

Usage Tips

Most of the time, using the strongest move is the best option. If running Trick, always use it against stall Pokemon like Galarian Corsola and Corviknight. Against Encore + Disable Pokemon like Alolan Ninetales, always use Bullet Punch instead of Meteor Mash to avoid getting locked into Struggle. Bullet Punch OHKOes some Pokemon such as Galarian Darmanitan, Weavile, and Archeops, so you should always use it to avoid the risk of getting KOed first. Against Zeraora, using Earthquake will always OHKO unless Zeraora uses Knock Off. In that case, you can use Bullet Punch turn 2 to KO it.

Choice Scarf.description:
Set Description

With a Choice Scarf, Metagross can surprise and outspeed numerous threats that normally beat it like Landorus-T and SubSeed Venusaur. Meteor Mash hits neutral targets like Porygon-Z hard and nails Steel-weak targets such as Sylveon and Tapu Lele. Earthquake hits Electric-types like Dracozolt and Tapu Koko, while Trick is used for stall Pokemon like Galarian Corsola and Cresselia. Ice Punch beats most Garchomp, Landorus, and Landorus-T, while Thunder Punch can be used to hit Choice Scarf Tapu Fini.

EVs

The HP EVs allow Metagross to survive Hydro Pump from Choice Specs Tapu Fini and Earthquake from Jolly Choice Scarf Garchomp. The Speed EVs allow it to outspeed base 110s like Latios. An alternative spread of 240 HP / 28 Atk / 96 Def / 144 Spe can be used with Rest in the last moveslot for a more defensive approach, letting it survive Jolly Choice Scarf Galarian Darmanitan's attacks and outspeed other Galarian Darmanitan sets. Also, it will have a better matchup versus stall Pokemon like Chansey, Blissey, and Sap Sipper Azumarill because of Rest.

Usage Tips

Using the highest damaging move most of the time works. Use Trick on Pokemon that cannot deal high damage, like Tapu Bulu, Togekiss, and stall Pokemon like Galarian Corsola and Corviknight, locking them into their low-damage or status moves.

Air Balloon.description:
Set Description

Air Balloon allows Metagross to beat Ground-types that usually counter it, like both Landorus formes, Garchomp, and Rhyperior. Meteor Mash hits targets like Rhyperior and Kyurem. Ice Punch hits the aforementioned Ground-types while also hitting Grass-types like Rillaboom. Earthquake hits Steel- and Electric-types like Magnezone and Zeraora, and Bullet Punch finishes off weakened foes and Custap Berry users like Sawk, Magnezone, and Crustle.

EVs

The HP EVs allow Metagross to survive Knock Off from Choice Band Landorus-T, while the Speed EVs are used for opposing Metagross and certain Carracosta sets. The remaining EVs are dumped into Attack for damage against Regidrago.

Usage Tips

Against Encore + Disable users like Gardevoir, Alolan Ninetales, and Aromatisse, always use Meteor Mash turn 1, and use Bullet Punch turn 2 to avoid being forced to use Struggle. Against Crustle, you use Bullet Punch turn 1 because it can use Counter, and then KO it with Meteor Mash the next turn. Against Aggron, you should use Bullet Punch turn 1 so that Metal Burst doesn't KO Metagross, and finish it off turn 2 with Earthquake.

Garchomp.comments:
Other Options

Garchomp can utilize a set with Haban Berry for Dragon-types like Naganadel and Dracovish. This set runs an EV spread of 248 HP / 48 Atk / 40 Def / 92 SpD / 80 Spe with the moves Swords Dance, Scale Shot, Earthquake, and Poison Jab. The defensive investment allows Garchomp to survive both Outrage and Fishious Rend from Adamant Choice Scarf Dracovish, as well as Draco Meteor from Modest Choice Specs Naganadel, while the Speed investment outspeeds base 80 Speed Pokemon like Venusaur and Regidrago. Swords Dance + Poison Jab on this set can defeat Fairy-types like Tapu Bulu, while Scale Shot handles most Dragon-types, including Dracovish. Garchomp can also run Fling on Choice Band sets in the fourth moveslot to break Heatran or Metagross's Air Balloon, KOing them with Earthquake in the following turn.

Custap Berry.description:
Set Description

Garchomp aims to surprise Pokemon such as Galarian Darmanitan, Naganadel, and Dragapult; the combination of Endure and Custap Berry allows it to move first and OHKO with its STAB moves. Outrage is also used to beat Dragon-types like Kommo-o that are naturally slower. Earthquake lets Garchomp beat Electric- and Fire-types like Zeraora, Tapu Koko, Regieleki, and Volcanion. Swords Dance gets past stall Pokemon like Chansey and Galarian Corsola.

EVs

96 HP EVs allow Garchomp to survive Outrage from Life Orb Zeraora, while the 44 Special Defense EVs let it take Steam Eruption from Choice Specs Volcanion. 120 Speed EVs are used to outspeed base 85 Speed Pokemon like Kommo-o, and 248 Attack EVs allow for better OHKO odds versus Galarian Darmanitan. Alternatively, an EV spread of 176 HP / 112 Atk / 80 Def / 120 Spe secures the matchup versus Choice Band Zeraora, as it takes Outrage, though the reduced Attack does not let Garchomp OHKO Galarian Darmanitan.

Usage Tips

Using Earthquake on turn 1 is usually the best option versus Zeraora and Volcanion, as Garchomp tanks most of their hits, but Choice Band Outrage from Zeraora OHKOes Garchomp unless it has the alternate EV spread, so some prediction is required. Using Endure is the best option against Pokemon that OHKO it, like Galarian Darmanitan, Dragapult and Naganadel. When in Custap Berry range, Outrage will OHKO these targets before they can move. Swords Dance should be used twice or thrice versus stall like Chansey or Galarian Corsola, respectively.

Choice Band.description:
Set Description

Choice Band Garchomp deals gargantuan amounts of damage, with Outrage beating Dragon-types such as Goodra, opposing Garchomp, and non-Choice Scarf Haxorus while also heavily damaging neutral targets like Venusaur. Earthquake OHKOes many Fire- and Steel-types including Entei, most Metagross, and Aegislash. Fire Fang helps versus Steel-types that are not weak to Earthquake such as Ferrothorn, Kartana, and some Celesteela. Stone Edge lets it win versus prominent Pokemon like Togekiss more often. On the other hand, Poison Jab beats Tapu Bulu and non-Kebia Berry Whimsicott, so it can be considered.

EVs

252 Speed EVs are used to Speed tie other Garchomp and outspeed base 100 Speed Pokemon like Entei, Volcarona, and Zapdos. The remaining EVs are invested into Attack to improve matchups versus Choice Scarf Togekiss and defensive Volcarona.

Usage Tips

Choice Band Garchomp is relatively straightforward to use, as either STAB attack will usually deal massive damage. Coverage for Fairy-types like Togekiss and Whimsicott should be used as necessary.

Life Orb.description:
Set Description

This set allows Garchomp to switch between its STAB and utility move options while retaining high damage output. Swords Dance allows it to boost versus foes like Tapu Bulu and Spectrier, which normally check Garchomp with Disable and Will-O-Wisp respectively, and then KO them. Life Orb-boosted Earthquake OHKOes Pokemon like Zeraora and Heatran. Scale Shot acts as a secondary boosting move by increasing Garchomp's Speed. It also counters stall Pokemon like Pressure Entei by breaking through Substitute. Poison Jab deals with Fairy-types like Tapu Bulu, whereas Outrage increases reliability versus Zapdos.

EVs

The 192 HP EVs secure the matchup versus Choice Specs Magnezone, as Garchomp survives Hyper Beam even after Life Orb recoil, and also assist versus stall Pokemon like Galarian Corsola and Registeel, ensuring that Night Shade and Seismic Toss take five hits to KO. 68 Defense EVs and the HP investment allow Garchomp to survive Outrage from Choice Band Zeraora. The 136 Speed EVs let Garchomp outspeed some faster Pokemon after Scale Shot, most notably Entei and Spectrier, while also outspeeding Pokemon like Dracozolt without the Speed boost.

Usage Tips

When versus Zeraora, use Earthquake, as you survive a Choice Band-boosted Outrage. Use Scale Shot versus Magnezone and other Sturdy users like Crustle to avoid risking Weakness Policy or Counter activation, respectively, and KO with Earthquake on turn 2. Scale Shot can also be used versus faster Pokemon like Entei and Spectrier to outspeed and KO in the following turns. The main use of Swords Dance is to break past passive stall Pokemon like Galarian Corsola and Registeel, as they cannot do enough damage before Garchomp KOes them. However, it also lets Garchomp KO some Pokemon more quickly, like Spectrier, as Swords Dance after a Scale Shot allows Garchomp to KO on turn 3.

Choice Scarf.description:
Set Description

Choice Scarf Garchomp is able to outspeed many of its checks like Galarian Darmanitan and Togekiss, as well as opposing Dragon-types like Dragapult, OHKOing them with Stone Edge or Outrage. Earthquake is a strong STAB move that hits Electric-types like Zeraora and Tapu Koko hard, while Outrage deals with neutral targets like Zapdos and Spectrier. Flamethrower secures matchups versus Grass-types like Kartana and some Ferrothorn sets, which usually check Garchomp, while Poison Jab provides more reliability versus Togekiss and has the added bonus of beating non-Kebia Berry Whimsicott.

EVs

This set runs 252 Speed EVs in order to outspeed Galarian Darmanitan, Togekiss, and Kartana. If running Poison Jab over Flamethrower, the 4 Special Attack EVs can be used in a different stat, and the nature should be changed to Jolly over Naive.

Usage Tips

The vast majority of the time, Choice Scarf Garchomp wins by using the appropriate high-damage move. Stone Edge should be used over Outrage for Galarian Darmanitan, as its higher damage matters versus some bulkier sets. If running Poison Jab over Flamethrower, use it on Togekiss over Stone Edge for its higher accuracy. Flamethrower should only be used against Pokemon that are quadruply weak to it, like Ferrothorn and Kartana. Against other Grass-types like Rillaboom and Venusaur, Outrage will do higher damage.

Togekiss.comments:
Other Options

Mental Herb instead of Maranga Berry sacrfices certain matchups like Volcanion for the ability to beat Taunt and Encore users such as Spectrier and Gardevoir. Additionally a Charm + Kee Berry set allows Togekiss to answer slower physical threats such as Metagross, Aggron, Rhyperior, and Glastrier by reducing their attack and healing with Roost, slowly chipping them down with Counter or Air Slash. A Choice Specs set sacrifices some of Togekiss's Speed for more power, being able to break down bulky Pokemon like Volcanion quickly and reliably because you don't need as many flinches. This set can also run Grass Knot as a niche move to catch Pokemon like Rhyperior and Swampert. Nasty Plot is another option that can be used over Encore on Thunder Wave variants. Nasty Plot can help against stall users like Kyurem and Leftovers Gastrodon, if running Encore. Resist Berry sets usually are paired with Counter. Babiri Berry, for example, can lure Pokemon like Metagross or Kartana by surviving a hit and using Counter. It can also run other Berries such as Wacan Berry, Charti Berry, and even Yache Berry for threats such as Choice Band Zeraora, Choice Band Landorus-T, and Galarian Darmanitan respectively. However, Togekiss often has to sacrifice a lot of matchups to run these sets due to it needing to dedicate nearly all of its resources to run them. This makes these sets relatively niche and often saved for tournament play.

Maranga Berry + Thunder Wave.description:
Set Description

Togekiss makes use of tactical RNG manipulation through Serene Grace, Air Slash, and paralysis to immobilize and break down foes. Maranga Berry allows it to more reliably wall many special attackers such as Primarina, Sylveon, and Volcanion. Thunder Wave is useful for speed control in addition to making immobilizing foes more reliable. Roost paired with paralysis allows Togekiss to fish for paralysis turns while recovering, which increases reliability even more. Encore is useful for locking stall Pokemon such as stall Cresselia and Corsola-G into their setup moves, as well as bulky offensive setup Pokemon like Galarian Moltres, Primarina, and Fake Tears Sylveon by locking them into their status moves.

EVs

The EVs allow Togekiss to survive Choice Specs Pixilate Sylveon's Hyper Beam and outspeed Choice Scarf Tapu Fini and Adamant Choice Scarf Haxorus after Thunder Wave. 52 Defense EVs maximize reliability against Assault Vest Arcanine and certain Dracovish sets.

An alternative spread of 96 HP / 140 SpA / 20 SpD / 252 Spe with a Timid nature allows Togekiss to defeat Magnezone with Mystical Fire. The EV spread allows Togekiss to defeat Choice Specs Volcarona and outspeeds bulky Tapu Fini variants as well as other Maranga Togekiss.

Usage Tips

Most matchups with Maranga Berry Togekiss begin with Togekiss using Thunder Wave Turn 1. However, against certain Trick users such as Cresselia and Choice Scarf Tapu Fini, it is safest to use Encore Turn 1. This locks you into Encore again but nets you a free move Turn 3 to use Air Slash, which locks you into Air Slash for the final turn of Encore on Turn 4, resetting the cycle. If the foe uses an attacking move Turn 1 and deals less than half of Togekiss's health, it is generally safe to spam Roost and fish for paralysis turns before going for flinches with Air Slash. This keeps Togekiss from dropping to a stray critical hit as well as not risking being caught by priority or some other gimmick such as a surprise Custap Berry user. If the foe uses a setup or status move such as Calm Mind, Swords Dance, or Substitute, Togekiss should usually use Encore to lock them into their move so they can safely break them down without needing to deal with flinch and paralysis chances as long as Togekiss outspeeds. Where Togekiss shouldn't use Encore is against Pokemon like Aromatisse. Instead, Togekiss should spam Air Slash in hopes of getting lucky and flinching Aromatisse down without being locked into Struggle by Encore and Disable.

Choice Scarf.description:
Set Description

Choice Scarf allows Togekiss to outspeed Pokemon such as Dragapult, Kartana, and non-Choice Scarf Tapu Fini. This pairs nicely Trick, which works to beat stall Pokemon such as non-AV Registeel while also locking Pokemon like stall Azumarill into a move. For coverage moves, Dazzling Gleam reliably takes out threats like Haxorus and Dracozolt, while Fire Blast can be used for Ferrothorn and Kartana.

EVs

Maximum Special Attack and Speed EVs allow Togekiss to do as much damage as possible and outspeed as many Pokemon as possible.

Alternatively, 16 HP / 236 SpA / 12 SpD / 244 Spe can be used to outspeed Dragapult and survive a Flash Cannon from Aegislash.

Usage Tips

Generally, this set is pretty simple to use. Use Air Slash when Togekiss needs to flinch a Pokemon like Naganadel or Volcanion that would KO it otherwise. Use Dazzling Gleam or Fire Blast when either of them more reliably wins the matchup such as against Garchomp or Ferrothorn, respectively. Trick is for opposing setup Pokemon as well as Pokemon like Tapu Fini, Dragapult, and Primarina that can't reliably 2HKO Togekiss. This allows Togekiss to outheal with Roost and makes the matchup more reliable in the long run.

Porygon-Z.comments:
Other Options

Porygon-Z can utilize a set with Chople Berry for Zeraora and Fighting-types like both Urshifu formes. This set runs an EV spread of 88 Def / 252 SpA / 168 Spe with a Modest nature and the moves Hyper Beam, Uproar, Agility, and Nasty Plot or Icy Wind. 88 Defense EVs allow Porygon-Z to survive a Plasma Fists from Choice Band Zeraora and use Agility turn 1 to outspeed and OHKO with Hyper Beam. Icy Wind can help out versus Sawk to break Sturdy and then KO with Hyper Beam.

Choice Specs.description:
Set Description

Choice Specs-boosted Hyper Beam is able to OHKO many top-tier Pokemon like Aromatisse, Cresselia, and Assault Vest Arcanine. Uproar can be beneficial against Whimsicott and Pressure Entei, which try to stall Porygon-Z out with Substitute. Thunderbolt beats Corviknight, and Ice Beam hits Garchomp and Dragapult. Trick + Recover + Nasty Plot allows Porygon-Z to shut down stall Pokemon like Chansey. Dark Pulse helps beat non-Assault Vest Metagross and is an option to hit Spectrier.

EVs

252 Speed EVs are used to outspeed Tapu Fini, Dracovish, Kommo-o, and some other Porygon-Z. An alternate EV spread of 68 Def / 184 SpA / 252 Spe reliably beats Garchomp with Ice Beam, as the 68 Defense EVs prevent the KO from Custap Berry Garchomp's Outrage.

Usage Tips

Hyper Beam is usually the best choice versus a neutral target like Azumarill or Cresselia, as it will do more damage than super effective coverage moves thanks to Adaptability. If Entei's Pressure is not revealed on turn 1, Porygon-Z should click Hyper Beam over Uproar, since Entei is using Inner Focus with Assault Vest instead of Substitute.

For coverage moves like Thunderbolt, Ice Beam, and Dark Pulse, it's best to use them on Pokemon like Celesteela and Spectrier, as they either resist or are immune to Hyper Beam. Nasty Plot Porygon-Z can use Trick and set up until Hyper Beam OHKOes Chansey.

Custap Berry.description:
Set Description

This Porygon-Z set aims to surprise Pokemon like Galarian Darmanitan, Naganadel, and opposing Porygon-Z by using Endure + Custap Berry. Hyper Beam deals an extreme amount of damage to Pokemon like Rillaboom, Tapu Fini, and Volcanion. Nasty Plot enables Porygon-Z to set up against stall Pokemon like Chansey and better damage foes like Sylveon and Primarina. Uproar helps versus Substitute users like Whimsicott and stall Entei, while Thunderbolt is helpful against Corviknight and Celesteela. Ice Beam hits Garchomp and Naganadel.

EVs

The defensive investment allows Porygon-Z to survive a Fake Out into Grassy Glide from Life Orb Rillaboom. The HP in specific lets it reliably beat Timid Choice Specs Tapu Fini. 216 Speed EVs are for base 85 Speed Pokemon without a boosting nature, such as Rillaboom, Cresselia, and Tapu Fini.

Usage Tips

Endure is the best move on turn 1 versus threats that can OHKO Porygon-Z like Galarian Darmanitan, Choice item Urshifu-S and Urshifu-R, and also Naganadel. Then, while in Custap Berry range, it can OHKO back with Hyper Beam or Ice Beam. If running Uproar, it should be used against Pokemon like Whimsicott turn 1 to bypass their Substitute and KO them before they can stall.

Choice Scarf.description:
Set Description

Choice Scarf Porygon-Z outspeeds fast threats like Zeraora and also other, slower Choice Scarf users in Dracozolt and Togekiss, OHKOing them with Hyper Beam. Trick + Recover effectively shuts down the likes of Chansey and Galarian Corsola. Dark Pulse hits Ghost-types like Spectrier and Galarian Corsola, while Ice Beam can be beneficial for Landorus-T especially with Assault Vest, and Garchomp.

EVs

This set runs maximum Speed investment to outspeed Zeraora and base 80 Speed or less Choice Scarf users like Togekiss, Dracozolt, and Dracovish. Maximum Special Attack allows it to get better KO odds versus Volcanion and stall Zapdos. A Modest nature improves its chances versus Maranga Berry Zapdos; however, it will not outspeed Choice Scarf Togekiss and Zeraora.

Usage Tips

Dark Pulse hits Ghost-types like Spectrier and Galarian Corsola for supereffective damage and Ice Beam helps versus Ground-types like Garchomp and Landorus. Using Trick + Recover and repeatedly clicking Hyper Beam wins versus Chansey.

Life Orb.description:
Set Description

This set has most of the same monstrous wallbreaking power that Porygon-Z is known for, but with the freedom to switch between its STAB attacks and utility options. Nasty Plot allows it to counter Mirror Coat users like Gastrodon and Assault Vest Swampert. Uproar secures the win versus Pressure stall Pokemon like Substitute + Protect Zapdos, Entei, Corviknight, and SubSeed users like Whimsicott. Substitute overwhelms hard stall Pokemon like Unaware Pyukumuku. Recover can increase Porygon-Z's longevity versus Pokemon like Seismic Toss Chansey, and Dark Pulse lets it hit Spectrier.

EVs

92 Special Defense EVs allow Porygon-Z to survive an Overheat from Choice Scarf Volcanion and OHKO back. With 176 Speed EVs, it outspeeds neutral-natured base 80 Speed Pokemon like Regidrago and Togekiss.

Usage Tips

Substitute should be used turn 1 versus Gastrodon to avoid moves like Mirror Coat and Clear Smog, then Nasty Plot on turn 2 lets Porygon-Z OHKO with Hyper Beam. However, if Gastrodon uses Amnesia turn 1, then Nasty Plot should be repeated until Porygon-Z reaches +6 and then Uproar is an OHKO or 2HKO, even after Chilan Berry. This same strategy should be used for Corviknight, as Nasty Plot boosted Hyper Beam OHKOes. However, if they use Substitute too, Nasty Plot should be used twice so that Uproar will at worst 2HKO.Substitute is the best move on turn 1 versus Pyukumuku to stop Mirror Coat then Uproar can be used for a 2HKO. Recover helps versus stall Pokemon like Seismic Toss Chansey, as Porygon-Z can boost up with Nasty Plot and heal off the damage to KO with Hyper Beam.

Rocky Helmet.description:
Set Description

This set punishes slower physical attackers that normally check Porygon-Z like Aggron, Rhyperior, and Metagross through Reflect + Rocky Helmet, chipping down their health until they are in Hyper Beam KO range. Nasty Plot can help versus some stall Pokemon or just bolster Hyper Beam's damage even more, while Recover helps Porygon-Z outlast its foes.

EVs

64 Defense EVs are so that Porygon-Z can survive three Choice Band Aggron Heavy Slams after Reflect, and the 188 Speed EVs allow it to outspeed Metagross. Maximum Special Attack is for the best Hyper Beam damage versus the aforementioned Pokemon.

Usage Tips

Reflect versus slower physical threats, like Aggron and Metagross, allows Porygon-Z to tank their hits and then use Recover until they are chipped down from Rocky Helmet. Hyper Beam should be used when it will OHKO the foe. Nasty Plot can reduce the turns needed to stall out foes like Aggron while also lowering the chances that Porygon-Z falls to a critical hit. It can also help Hyper Beam eventually OHKO versus stall Pokemon like Chansey, with Recover helping Porygon-Z set up.

Choice Band.description:
Set Description

Galarian Darmanitan uses its great Attack, decent Speed tier, Gorilla Tactics, and Choice Band to OHKO as many opponents as possible before they can move. Either Icicle Crash or Ice Punch can be used; Ice Punch has perfect accuracy, but Icicle Crash has more power, notably securing matchups against Bulk Up Zarude, Rocky Helmet Aromatisse, and physically bulky Tapu Lele. Icicle Crash also has a 30% flinch chance, allowing Galarian Darmanitan to potentially beat Sturdy users and bulkier threats like Crustle and Aromatisse. Giga Impact OHKOes many bulkier Pokemon such as Sylveon and Primarina and even has a chance to OHKO physically defensive Tapu Fini. Flare Blitz does massive damage to Steel-types, notably OHKOing Registeel and non-Occa Berry Celesteela, and also helps Galarian Darmanitan defeat slower Volcarona sets. The last move is usually one of Superpower, Earthquake, or Iron Head. Superpower helps against Tyranitar, Air Balloon Heatran, bulky Kyurem and Chansey, Earthquake beats some Arcanine and Sitrus Berry Volcanion more reliably, and Iron Head reliably beats Aromatisse.

EVs

Adamant is usually preferred, as it performs better versus bulkier Pokemon, like Tapu Fini and Aromatisse. The 4 Special Defense EVs block Pokemon with the ability Download, most notably Porygon2, from getting +1 Special Attack.

On bulkier spreads, Giga Impact is less valuable, since it lacks the necessary Attack investment to OHKO Tapu Fini. However, it is still valuable versus Sylveon and Primarina.

An alternative spread of 88 Atk / 244 Def / 176 Spe outspeeds Rillaboom and survives Celesteela's uninvested Heavy Slam and Life Orb Rillaboom's Fake Out + Grassy Glide.

An alternative spread of 8 HP / 116 Atk / 132 SpD / 252 Spe survives Choice Scarf Togekiss's Fire Blast and Choice Specs Tapu Fini's Hydro Pump so that it can KO them with Icicle Crash and two Earthquakes, respectively.

Usage Tips

If Galarian Darmanitan does not have Iron Head, it should use Icicle Crash or Ice Punch against Aromatisse, rather than Giga Impact. Even though Giga Impact has a chance to OHKO, it has better odds to 2HKO with Ice Punch or Icicle Crash + Struggle. Galarian Darmanitan is 2HKOed by Moonblast and Rocky Helmet damage from Aromatisse, which means that if Aromatisse dodges or survives Giga Impact turn 1 and uses Trick Room, it can use Moonblast, disable Giga Impact as it recharges, and use Moonblast again to KO Galarian Darmanitan.

With the defensive spread, use Icicle Crash or Ice Punch versus Celesteela instead of Flare Blitz. This ensures that Celesteela will not KO Galarian Darmanitan afterwards, and the Ice-type moves 2HKO most Celesteela.

Choice Scarf.description:
Set Description

Icicle Crash is Galarian Darmanitan's strongest STAB option. Superpower beats non-Chople variants of Porygon-Z, Urshifu-S, and Kyurem. Earthquake is for Nihilego, Entei, and Zeraora. The last move is more variable, depending on the needs of the team; Flare Blitz for a better Celesteela and Metagross matchup, Thrash for Choice Scarf Tapu Fini, Rock Slide for Volcarona, or Lash Out for Spectrier.

EVs

Galarian Darmanitan runs maximum Speed and a Speed-boosting nature to outspeed Choice Scarf Porygon-Z and Pheromosa. The leftover 4 EVs are put into Special Defense so Download users like Porygon2 get an Attack boost instead of a Special Attack boost.

An Adamant nature instead of a Jolly nature helps versus Heatran, but loses out on Timid Choice Scarf Kyurem and Porygon-Z, as well as other Galarian Darmanitan.

An alternative spread of 160 Atk / 112 Def / 236 Spe and an Adamant nature allows Galarian Darmanitan to survive Jolly Garchomp's Stone Edge and Adamant Garchomp's Outrage, so this spread is fairly reliable versus Choice Scarf and Custap Berry Garchomp.

If using Thrash, consider an EV spread of 4 HP / 144 Atk / 104 SpD / 252 Spe to survive Choice Specs Tapu Fini's Hydro Pump.

Usage Tips

In nearly every matchup, use the move that does the most damage to come out on top.

Zen Mode.description:
Set Description

Icicle Crash and, after activating Zen Mode, Flare Blitz are Galarian Darmanitan's strongest STAB options. In most matchups, Zen Mode is triggered when Galarian Darmanitan uses Endure on an attack that would otherwise OHKO it, activating both Zen Mode and the Salac Berry. To round out this set, Galarian Darmanitan-Z can use Encore to lock opponents into non-damaging moves, such as Endure. Reversal is another option, which can defeat Kyurem and Heatran.

EVs

Adamant is the preferred nature, as base 135 Speed and at +1 Speed outspeeds all relevant threats.

Usage Tips

When Galarian Darmanitan-Z can outspeed and OHKO an opponent, such as Venusaur and Ferrothorn, Galarian Darmanitan should just attack turn 1. Other matchups, where Darmanitan is outsped and OHKOed, like versus Pheromosa and Kartana, Galarian Darmanitan should use Endure, activate the Salac Berry, and OHKO the next turn.

Note that Galarian Darmanitan-Z is much weaker without Gorilla Tactics, so it does not KO bulkier Pokemon that it normally expects to like Regidrago.

Crustle.comments:
Other Options

Another item option for Shell Smash Crustle is White Herb to safely set up against Breaking Swipe Regidrago, physically defensive Landorus-T, and fast Rock Tomb Dracovish. Make sure you are slower than Regidrago to have White Herb go into effect on Breaking Swipe's Attack drop and not on the Defense and Special Defense drops of Shell Smash. Solar Blade can be used on the Choice Band set to lure Pokemon such as Swampert, Gastrodon, and Quagsire.

Shell Smash.description:
Set Description

The combination of Sturdy and Mental Herb allows Crustle to safely set up against nearly any Pokemon without the threat of Taunt, Encore, or being OHKOed. Sturdy allows Crustle to live at least one hit from Pokemon such as Celesteela, Galarian Darmanitan, Volcanion, Volcarona, Kyurem, and non-Mold Breaker Haxorus, and due to the immense power of Rock Wrecker, they will be OHKOed after a Shell Smash boost. Mental Herb allows Crustle to safely Shell Smash against Encore Aromatisse and Taunt users such as Whimsicott. Rock Blast is used to break past Substitute users such as Entei, Zapdos, or Whimsicott to avoid Rock Wrecker's recharge turn. For the fourth moveslot, Counter is often used to beat Choice item Dracovish, non-Mold Breaker Haxorus, and some Zeraora sets. X-Scissor is occasionally used over Counter to beat Trick Cresselia and Zarude consistently. Lum Berry can be used to consistently beat Yawn Sylveon and can help in the Will-O-Wisp Volcanion matchup.

EVs

Maximum Speed investment allows Crustle to outspeed most of the metagame after a Shell Smash, while maximum Attack gives it the best rolls to OHKO a non-Defense invested Porygon-Z. Mental Herb Crustle can also use a Jolly Nature with the same EVs to outspeed Electric Seed Tapu Koko after a Shell Smash and KO it with Rock Wrecker.

Usage Tips

Crustle's main strategy is to utilize the combination of Sturdy and Shell Smash to set up without being OHKOed, and OHKO back with Rock Wrecker. Crustle can also use the combination of Shell Smash and Rock Blast to break past Substitute Pokemon like Zapdos or Entei. Against Pokemon such as Primarina or Sylveon, which can potentially run Custap Berry, you may want to Shell Smash twice to avoid clicking Rock Wrecker on Endure. It is important to note that due to Crustle's low Speed tier, it will not be able to outspeed Zeraora or Dragapult at +2 Speed.

Choice Band.description:
Set Description

With Choice Band, Crustle is able to OHKO Pokemon such as Porygon-Z without Reflect, Primarina, and offensive Azumarill. Rock Blast is used to break through Substitute Pokemon like Zapdos, Entei, and Volcarona, while Earthquake secures the Zeraora and Aegislash matchups. Choice Band Crustle has several options for the last move: Heavy Slam consistently beats Aromatisse and Sylveon, X-Scissor is used to beat Zarude and Trick Cresselia, and Counter beats Choice item attackers such as Dracovish, Urshifu-S, and Garchomp.

EVs

232 HP and 24 Def EVs allow Crustle to survive Choice Band Haxorus's Outrage. 29 Speed IVs, along with a Brave Nature allow Crustle to underspeed Aegislash and OHKO its Blade Forme.

Usage Tips

Choice Band Crustle is very straightforward; in nearly every matchup you should use the strongest move, whether it is Rock Wrecker, Heavy Slam, or Earthquake. The one exception to this is against Substitute Pokemon, where Rock Blast is better.

Iron Defense + Chople Berry.description:
Set Description

Thanks to its incredible mixed bulk, Ferrothorn can handle many top-tier threats such as Primarina, Tapu Fini, and Magnezone. Holding a Chople Berry allows it to beat Fighting-types such as Pheromosa, non-Fire Punch Sawk, and Urshifu-R.

Gyro Ball is typically Ferrothorn's strongest move and helps it deal with Fairy-types such as Sylveon, Tapu Lele and, Diancie. Iron Defense + Body Press allows Ferrothorn to deal with threats such as Zeraora without Blaze Kick and Chansey, increasing both its physical bulk and Body Press's power.

For its final moveslot, it can either run Leech Seed or Power Whip. Leech Seed lets you beat Assault Vest and Haban Berry Regidrago, Assault Vest Landorus-T, and Iron Defense Registeel. Power Whip allows Ferrothorn to hit Water-types like Tapu Fini and Primarina.

EVs

248 HP and 52 Defense EVs with a Relaxed nature allow Ferrothorn to survive a Choice Band-boosted Close Combat from Jolly Choice Band Haxorus; 28 Attack EVs ensure that Ferrothorn OHKOes Haxorus after Iron Barbs damage and the Defense drop. The Special Defense EVs are for Custap Berry and Rocky Helmet Porygon-Z, as well as Gardevoir if Ferrothorn has Leech Seed. 0 Speed IVs is used to maximize the damage of Gyro Ball.

Another EV spread is 248 HP / 160 Def / 100 SpD. This bulks a Hyper Beam from Choice Specs Porygon-Z and 2HKOes with Body Press.

Usage Tips

Pokemon such as Tapu Fini and Metagross can use Trick to give Ferrothorn a Choice item. To handle this, Ferrothorn should use a damaging move against these Pokemon (removed E accent) turn 1. Against Encore + Disable Alolan Ninetales, Ferrothorn should use Gyro Ball turn one, and it should use either Power Whip or Leech Seed next turn to avoid wasting a turn due to Disable. This guarantees a win against both Encore + Disable and Life Orb variants of Alolan Ninetales. Against Zeraora, Ferrothorn should use Iron Defense on the first turn, which lets it survive the second turn and then KO with Body Press due to Close Combat Defense drops. If you believe your opponent is running a defensive Urshifu-R, use Iron Defense on the first turn to not get KOed by Body Press. However, if you suspect Urshifu-R is offensive, use Power Whip on the first turn instead to OHKO it after Close Combat. Be mindful that some Pokemon may run Fire-type coverage for Ferrothorn's 4x weakness to deal with it, such as Zeraora, Urshifu-R, Dragapult, and Dracozolt.

Custap Berry.description:
Set Description

The combination of Endure + Custap Berry allows Ferrothorn to survive a hit that would KO and move first the next turn. Gyro Ball, which is often Ferrothorn's strongest move, helps beat Pokemon such as Galarian Darmanitan, Togekiss, and Sylveon. Payback helps Ferrothorn beat Pokemon like non-Choice Specs Magnezone, Metagross, and Trick + Choice Scarf Cresselia. Revenge helps the Magnezone matchup and helps Ferrothorn beat Aggron. Leech Seed solidifies the Aromatisse and Regidrago matchups by allowing Ferrothorn to survive longer and set up further Swords Dances.

EVs

240 HP EVs, 52 Defense EVs, and a Relaxed nature allow Ferrothorn to survive Fire Fang from Choice Band Garchomp.

Usage Tips

If a Pokemon's attack will bring Ferrothorn to 25% or less health, it can set up a Swords Dance on the first turn and use its Custap Berry to move first on the next turn. This strategy can be used against Zeraora, Landorus without Protect, and Rillaboom. Against potential Encore users, Ferrothorn should use a damaging move to avoid being locked into Swords Dance or Endure. Against Choice Scarf Togekiss, usually use Endure the first turn to predict their Fire-type coverage and then Gyro Ball on the second turn. However, Togekiss can also use Trick or Encore on the first turn. To avoid this, Ferrothorn can use Gyro Ball on the first turn. Against Alolan Ninetales, Ferrothorn should use Gyro Ball into Power Whip to prevent Disable and Encore from forcing it to use Struggle. Against Aromatisse, Ferrothorn should use Leech Seed on the first turn due to Gyro Balls low damage output; due to its HP investment, it can beat Aromatisse even after Aromatisse locks it into Leech Seed or makes it use Struggle. Custap Berry Ferrothorn can beat Choice Band Garchomp by clicking Swords Dance into Gyro Ball, and it beats Regidrago by using Gyro Ball first to avoid being OHKOed by a combination of Dragon Energy and Draco Meteor.

Haxorus.comments:
Other Options

For both Choice Band and Choice Scarf sets, Haxorus can run Rivalry as its ability for a small niche to beat gender locked Pokemon that would normally be hard counters. A female Choice Scarf and Choice Band Haxorus can beat Choice Scarf Cresselia and Chansey, respectively. A male Choice Scarf Haxorus can beat Landorus. A downside to this is that it can be inconsistent versus a lot of Pokemon, as their gender is chosen at random.

Choice Band.description:
Set Description

Haxorus is the only viable Unnerve user, allowing it to bypass Custap Berry and resistance Berries, making it a Dragon-type that effectively defeats other Dragon-types. Additionally, its pure Dragon typing allows it to take on a lot of Pokemon in the metagame, such as Regidrago and Rillaboom. Thanks to its high Attack stat and strong moves, it breaks past Pokemon like Volcanion, Tapu Bulu, and Volcarona. Mold Breaker can be used instead of Unnerve to beat Pokemon such as Magnezone, Sawk, Aggron, and, if Haxorus has Aqua Tail, Rhyperior.

Outrage is a strong STAB attack that can be used against other Dragon-types, like Regidrago, Goodra, and Kommo-o, or other Pokemon that take neutral damage such as Volcanion, Volcarona, and Rillaboom. Low Kick and Superpower are used to avoid the Special Defense stat drops from Close Combat: Low Kick and Superpower are used to beat Heatran and Magnezone, while Superpower is used with an Adamant nature to have a better matchup against Urshifu-S and Chansey but with a worse matchup against Ferrothorn. Iron Tail OHKOes Sylveon and threatens Fairy-types like non-Choice Scarf Tapu Lele and some Togekiss. Earthquake beats a few Metagross and Tapu Koko sets. Poison Jab beats Tapu Bulu, threatens a few Tapu Koko sets, and is more reliable versus Whimsicott. First Impression can be used for Regieleki, Hydreigon, and Zarude, while Aqua Tail is used with Mold Breaker to beat Rhyperior. Counter can beat Play Rough Arcanine and some Metagross sets.

EVs

Maximum Attack and Speed investment makes Haxorus as fast and powerful as possible. A Jolly nature allows Haxorus to outspeed non-Choice Scarf Galarian Darmanitan, non-Choice Scarf Porygon-Z, and non-Choice Scarf Tapu Lele. Alternatively, an Adamant nature can be used to beat Venusaur and Jellicent. An alternate EV spread of 8 HP / 164 Atk / 160 SpD / 176 Spe with an Adamant nature can be used to survive special attacks from the likes of Landorus and Regieleki.

Usage Tips

Choice Band Haxorus is very straightforward use the super effective move or the move that does the most damage on a neutral target.

Choice Scarf.description:
Set Description

Choice Scarf allows Haxorus to outpace common Pokemon that would normally outspeed and KO it, most notably Choice Scarf Galarian Darmanitan, Choice Scarf Porygon-Z, and maximum Speed Dragapult. Unnerve lets Haxorus beat Custap Berry users like Porygon-Z and Galarian Zapdos, while Mold Breaker beats Sturdy Pokemon like Magnezone, Aggron, and some Sawk. Outrage is a strong STAB attack for Dragon-types like Dragapult and Goodra, and Earthquake beats Magnezone and some Metagross sets. Low Kick avoids the stat drops from Close Combat, but Superpower with an Adamant nature can be used instead to beat frail Urshifu-S and beat most Magnezone. Poison Jab beats Whimsicott and Choice Scarf Togekiss lacking Dazzling Gleam, while Counter beats Play Rough Arcanine and a few Metagross sets.

EVs

Maximum Attack and Speed investment makes Haxorus as fast and powerful as possible. A Jolly nature allows Haxorus to outspeed and OHKO threats like Jolly Choice Scarf Galarian Darmanitan, Timid Choice Scarf Porygon-Z, and Dragapult, while an Adamant nature is better versus Regidrago and Kommo-o.

Usage Tips

Choice Scarf Haxorus is very straightforward use the super effective move or the move that does the most damage on a neutral target.

Custap Berry.description:
Set Description

Custap Berry allows Haxorus to beat Regidrago and fast, frail attackers like Galarian Darmanitan and Naganadel in one set. Swords Dance helps Haxorus break through slower threats like Metagross, Chansey, and Assault Vest Registeel. Unnerve helps Haxorus beat opposing Custap Berry and resistance Berry users like Regidrago, while Mold Breaker allows Haxorus beat Sturdy Pokemon such as Magnezone, Aggron, and Sawk.

EVs

The Defense EVs allow Haxorus to survive a Meteor Mash from Adamant Choice Band Metagross. The Speed investment is for Jolly Dracovish and Dracozolt, and the remaining EVs are put in Attack for the best Regidrago matchup.

Usage Tips

Against Pokemon that cannot threaten to OHKO Haxorus, such as Regidrago and Rillaboom, Haxorus should attack turn 1. Against a foe that threatens to OHKO Haxorus, such as Galarian Darmanitan, Endure allows Haxorus to take the hit and OHKO back. Use Swords Dance against Chansey turn 1, then use Superpower on turn 2. Use Swords Dance against Metagross turn 1, then use Earthquake turn 2. However, if Metagross is revealed to have Choice Scarf, and the damage dealt is less than 75%, Haxorus should use Endure turn 2 and Earthquake turn 3, activating its Custap Berry to move first.

Life Orb.description:
Set Description

The combination of Swords Dance and Life Orb boost Haxorus's Attack to high levels, allowing it to effectively break defensive Pokemon. Outrage is a strong STAB move, and Superpower hits Steel-types like Magnezone and Registeel. Taunt and Swords Dance combined allows Haxorus to beat Pokemon like Registeel, Chansey and Galarian Corsola, while Dragon Dance and Poison Jab allow Haxorus to beat some Tapu Koko sets, Whimsicott, and Tapu Bulu.

EVs

The HP and Special Defense EVs allow Haxorus to survive a Hyper Beam from Modest Choice Specs Regieleki. The Speed investment is for Jolly Dracovish and Dracozolt, and the remaining EVs are put in Attack for maximum damage output.

Usage Tips

If running Taunt, Haxorus should use it turn 1 on stall Pokemon like Registeel, Chansey, and Galarian Corsola, then boost its Attack stat to an appropriate level to secure an OHKO or 2HKO.

Sylveon.comments:
Other Options

A Babiri Berry gives Yawn Sylveon a fighting chance against Pokemon like Choice Band Tyranitar, Aggron, Steelix, and Kartana, though the more popular Steel-types, such as Celesteela, Metagross, Ferrothorn, and Registeel, remain insurmountable walls.

Yawn sets with Fake Tears and Hyper Beam can run Life Orb for maximum offensive power. This set can punch holes in threats that ordinarily would wall Sylveon, beating bulky Ferrothorn and bulky Celesteela with two Fake Tears into Hyper Beam; note that these foes might wake up early so you may have to play around a potential Endure. This option can also OHKO Pokemon that would normally be able to tank a single move, such as Azumarill and bulky Tapu Bulu. An EV spread of 252 HP / 48 Def / 172 SpA / 36 SpD with a Quiet nature and 29 Speed IVs lets Sylveon survive Choice Specs Sylveon's Hyper Beam as well as maximum Attack Ferrothorn's Gyro Ball while still outspeeding typical Chansey and Azumarill sets. The remaining EVs have been put into Special Attack for the best chance to beat physically defensive Aromatisse.

Choice Specs.description:
Set Description

With Choice Specs, Sylveon can break out immensely powerful moves on the first turn of battle. Hyper Voice is a good move against frail Pokemon like Regieleki, common Substitute users like Dragapult and Whimsicott, and common Endure users like Garchomp. Hyper Beam OHKOes neutral targets like physically defensive Aromatisse and Landorus. Echoed Voice beats Substitute Zapdos variants lacking Eerie Impulse, as well as certain specially bulky Trick Cresselia sets. Mystical Fire is a coverage option that beats Ferrothorn. Psyshock handles Power Herb Nihilego, and Draining Kiss has niche usage against Kommo-o, which can block all of Sylveon's other moves with Substitute and Soundproof, as well as Custap Berry and Choice Scarf variants of Sawk, which cannot 2HKO Sylveon after it heals.

EVs

The HP EVs allow Sylveon to tank Choice Specs Landorus's Sludge Wave. Special Attack is maxed out to grant the best possible chances against targets like Assault Vest Goodra, Landorus, and non-Psychic Seed Tapu Lele. The Speed investment allows Sylveon to always outpace Adamant Rhyperior. The remainder is put in Defense for the best survival odds against Choice Band Garchomp's Earthquake.

Alternatively, Sylveon can run a bulky spread of 224 HP / 148 SpA / 136 SpD with a Calm nature. This allows it to tank Adamant Choice Band Dragapult's Phantom Force, as well as Choice Specs Naganadel's Sludge Wave. If ran alongside Psyshock, it notably allows Sylveon to tank a hit from any Nihilego set and OHKO it back.

Usage Tips

In general, Choice Specs Sylveon has a simple gameplan: use Hyper Voice. Hyper Beam should be used against Pokemon which have the potential to KO Sylveon before it can attack a second time, such as Azumarill, Goodra, and Landorus-T. The remaining moves are very situational and should not be used outside of their listed matchups.

Choice Specs Sylveon commonly finds itself in uncertain matchups against Custap Berry users. Custap Berry Primarina, for instance, beats a Sylveon using Hyper Beam by opening with Endure. However, if Sylveon uses Hyper Voice, Primarina wins by using Moonblast followed by Endure then KOing with a Torrent-boosted Hydro Cannon. As such matchups are effectively coin flips, no advice allows for consistent victories.

Custap Berry.description:
Set Description

With Endure and a Custap Berry, Sylveon can survive powerful attacks like Choice Specs Porygon-Z's Hyper Beam, Choice Band Galarian Darmanitan's Giga Impact, and Choice Specs Naganadel's Sludge Wave, then retaliate with a powerful attack. Hyper Beam OHKOes the aforementioned Pokemon and helps against Goodra and Aromatisse. Hyper Voice is useful against Substitute users like Dragapult and Whimsicott and Sturdy Pokemon like Crustle and Sawk, while Fake Tears offers an anti-stall tool to be used against Sap Sipper Azumarill, defensive Chansey, and Cresselia sets without Trick or Skill Swap.

EVs

Maximum Special Attack allows for optimal odds against Trick Togekiss and Tapu Koko. The Defense EVs allow Sylveon to always survive Adamant Life Orb Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes. The remainder of the EVs are put in Speed to try and outspeed other base 60s, like Primarina and opposing Sylveon, as well as possible.

Usage Tips

Broadly speaking, Sylveon should use Hyper Voice or Fake Tears on turns it's not at risk of getting OHKOed, and it should go for Endure followed by Hyper Beam on turns where it is. However, against Pokemon with priority moves, like Azumarill and Urshifu-R, it is not possible to safely drop to 1 HP. Sylveon should also beware of using Hyper Beam on Endure from Pokemon like Tyranitar and Rhyperior; instead, it should use Fake Tears if you predict Endure. Unlike most Custap Berry users, Sylveon should use Endure turn one against Regieleki, as it will always survive and consume its Custap Berry next turn, whereas attacking runs the risk of fainting to Electro Ball. While Sylveon beats most Choice-locked Dragon types, it loses to Choice Scarf Dracovish and Dracozolt, as their signature moves' power is less on turns where Sylveon uses Endure, and it is consequently not put into Custap Berry range. The optimal play in these matchups is to use Endure twice in a row, giving Sylveon a 1/3 chance to activate its Custap Berry.

Yawn.description:
Set Description

Sylveon is the best Yawn user and, in fact, the best sleep inducer in the whole SS 1v1 metagame, as it boasts good bulk, powerful attacks, and potentially a very solid setup move. A Mental Herb allows Sylveon to safely use Yawn versus Taunt and Encore users like Aromatisse, Primarina, Spectrier, Togekiss and Gardevoir. Hyper Voice is able to beat Substitute users like Dragapult and Whimsicott, but Hyper Beam's higher damage offers reliability versus Pokemon like Choice Scarf Galarian Darmanitan and Modest Porygon-Z without a boosting item. Fake Tears notably gives the set a shot at beating Maranga Berry Corviknight, which is otherwise a hard Sylveon counter. The move also helps versus walls like Tapu Koko and Sap Sipper Azumarill.

EVs

The HP EVs allow Sylveon to survive Choice Specs Regieleki's Electro Ball. The Defense EVs let it tank Surging Strikes from Adamant Choice Band Urshifu-R. The remaining EVs have been put in Special Attack to improve odds versus Pokemon like Primarina and Togekiss.

Usage Tips

When a foe is on their third sleep turnthus guaranteed to wake up next turnand is impossible to KO in a single move, it is usually advantageous for Sylveon to re-apply Yawn's drowsinessusing Protect against slower foes so that they can wake upas this yields several additional turns.

Beware of Pokemon potentially carrying Trick, like Togekiss, Porygon-Z, Cresselia, and Telepathy Tapu Fini, and do not use Yawn or Fake Tears against an unknown set. Protect may be used to scout for this eventuality, though at the risk of being set up onit is often safer to simply attack.

Note that Tapu Koko's Electric Terrain and Tapu Fini's Misty Terrain both prevent sleep, making Yawn a waste of a turn against these Pokemon. Likewise, Yawn should not be used against Porygon-Z, as that Pokemon commonly runs Uproar. Finally, both Urshifu formes ignore Protect with their ability. Do not use Yawn against these Pokemon, as there is no guarantee Sylveon will be able to survive until the foe falls asleep.

Volcanion.comments:
Other Options

Volcanion can run Life Orb to help improve the Celesteela and Sylveon matchups even further, using a moveset of Overheat, Steam Eruption, Sludge Wave, and Flame Charge. Sludge Wave is used over Sludge Bomb because Volcanion doesn't need the extra poison chance, since Sylveon would do enough damage to KO -2 Volcanion with the additional Life Orb recoil.

Choice Band Volcanion can lure in Pokemon that would normally beat it, such as Tapu Lele, Spectrier, and Togekiss with a moveset of Liquidation, Overheat, Flare Blitz, and Heavy Slam, although some of its matchups are a bit unreliable.

Choice Specs.description:
Set Description

Volcanion carries a niche in 1v1 with its unique typing and good bulk, which gives it very good matchups versus two common type cores in 1v1: Fairy + Fire + Steel and Fire + Water + Grass. Sludge Bomb is used over Sludge Wave for the greater poison chance, which helps in the Sylveon matchup. Earth Power can be used for opposing Volcanion, and Hyper Beam for most Haxorus, while Fling and Water Pulse can be used for Avalugg and Pressure stall Entei, respectively.

EVs

248 HP EVs and 108 Defense EVs let Volcanion survive Fake Out + Wood Hammer from Adamant Life Orb Rillaboom, as well as Earthquake from Adamant Choice Band Haxorus. The Special Defense allows it to take a Hyper Beam at -2 Special Defense from Modest Sylveon. The Speed investment outspeeds Adamant Rhyperior and some Metagross. The remaining EVs are dumped into Special Attack.

Usage Tips

Choice Specs Volcanion is fairly straightforwardOverheat is almost always advised if both of Volcanion's STAB moves are neutral against the foe. If running Fling, use it versus Avalugg turn 1, then Overheat turn 2.

Sitrus Berry.description:
Set Description

Sitrus Berry Volcanion trades the raw power of Choice Specs for better matchups against a few physical attackers, most notably Aggron, Sawk, Avalugg, and some Dracovish. Sitrus Berry secures the positive matchup against Choice Band Sawk and Assault Vest Urshifu-S, and it helps against Registeel. Will-O-Wisp beats various physical attackers, and Haze helps versus Registeel and Spectrier.

EVs

The HP and Defense EVs allow Volcanion to survive Fake Out + Wood Hammer from Adamant Life Orb Rillaboom. The Speed investment outspeeds Adamant Aggron, and the rest of the EVs are dumped into Special Attack.

Usage Tips

Against opposing Aggron, Avalugg, and Sawk, Volcanion should use Will-O-Wisp turn 1 to break Sturdy and survive a hit, then Overheat on turn 2 to KO or Steam Eruption against Aggron to minimise misses. To beat Urshifu-S, first use Will-O-Wisp to make sure it won't 2HKO Volcanion, then use Steam Eruption, and then Overheat to maximize damage output and minimize miss chances. However, if the damage Volcanion takes reveals Urshifu-S to have Choice Band, Overheat should be used immediately after Will-O-Wisp to KO it.

Choice Scarf.description:
Set Description

Choice Scarf Volcanion outspeeds and surprises some of its checks like Landorus, Nihilego, Pressure Entei, and Galarian Darmanitan. Earthquake OHKOes Nihilego, while Heavy Slam beats most Tapu Lele. Fling can also be used for Avalugg.

EVs
